longBusinessSummary: Nankai Electric Railway Co., Ltd. operates as a railway company in Japan. The company operates through six segments: Transportation, Real Estate, Retail, Leisure and Services, Construction, and Other. The Transportation segment operates railways, tramways, buses, and ferries; and provides freight transportation, and rolling stock maintenance services. This segment operates a total of eight main and branch lines with a track length of approximately 154.8 kilometers, as well as manages a total of 100 stations. The Real Estate segment leases land, buildings, and rental spaces; and develops and sells large-scale and line-side residential projects, single-family home subdivisions, and condominiums. The Retail segment operates and manages shopping centers; manages convenience stores, merchandise stores, and restaurants, as well as commercial facilities. The Leisure and Services segment is involved in the operation of amusement park, as well as a hotel and Japanese-style guesthouse; rental of motorboat-racing stadium; and golf-course management activities. This segment also offers travel agency and funeral services; and building management and maintenance services, such as equipment management, and facilities security and cleaning services. The Construction segment provides construction works for apartments and housing, building and maintaining facilities, and civil engineering, construction, and electricity. The Other segment engages in the information system business. The company was founded in 1885 and is headquartered in Osaka, Japan.
